description: Fresh and clean for the most part, with light raspberry and strawberry aromas. It's a little cloying on the palate, but the flavors of citrus and melon, while briney, are lasting and move in the right direction. A good buy made from the obscure Bobal variety and Tempranillo.
title: Dominio de Eguren 2008 Protocolo Rosado Rosé (Tierra de Castilla)

description: Young, fresh and jammy, this blend of Grenache, Petite Sirah, Dolcetto and Sangiovese has flavors of cherries, leather, anise and cedar. It's an easy, rustic wine to drink with BBQ.
title: Gianelli 2007 Nino Red (Tuolumne County)

description: Soft, lightly creamy, with hints of raspberry and fresh red currants. The mousse is fleeting, leaving fruit and acidity.
title: Grandin NV Brut Rosé Méthode Traditionelle Sparkling (Vin Mousseux)

description: Soft and easy in texture, with a silky mouthfeel framing flavors of cherries, herbs and herbs. There's some bitterness throughout. Try with rich meats or hard cheeses.
title: Vino Valpredo 2007 Squeezebox Red Red (Sonoma County)

description: Though the first sniffs seem to promise a light, floral, elegant Pinot Noir, it turns vegetal in the glass, with tomato and herbal flavors.
title: Maysara 2007 Asha Pinot Noir (McMinnville)

description: Overripe, with a raisiny, pruny edge to the blackberries and cherries. There's also some bitterness throughout. Not likely to age, so drink up.
title: Rutherford Hill 2006 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

description: Too heavy for a rosé, with black cherry, cola and leather flavors that lack the delicacy and zest you want in a blush wine.
title: Saddleback 2008 Rosato di Sangiovese (Rutherford)

description: Tight, compact and rubbery on the nose, with a mineral, medicinal edge to the black-fruit aromas. Snappy and hard on the cheeks, with midland berry fruit and a scouring, juicy, woody finish. Lots of red fruit but scratchy and a little medicinal.
title: Bodegas Imperiales 2005 Finca Helena  (Ribera del Duero)

description: Dry and soft, this is a pretty Merlot to drink with lusty fare, like barbecued pork and tri-tip. It has tannin-inspired flavors of black cherries, red currants, mocha, bacon and spice. Drink now.
title: Brutocao 2006 Bliss Vineyard Estate Bottled Merlot (Mendocino)

description: Super-fruity, a real orchard, with pineapples, apples, Meyer lemons and even something tropical, like mango. In fact, a little too sweet, almost cloying on the finish.
title: C.G. di Arie 2008 Sauvignon Blanc (Shenandoah Valley (CA))

description: Here's an archetypical Cabernet Franc nose: green vegetables, cigar, tobacco and tomato skin. Raw tomato notes come through on the silky palate while a bit of rhubarb marks the medium finish. Drink up.
title: Atwater 2006 Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

description: Very fragrant and floral, this fun Prosecco (closed with a string instead of a capsule) offers aromas of sweet fruit and honeysuckle. The wine is simple, clean, crisp and ends with bright peach flavors.
title: Lisabella NV Gran Resèe Prosecco (Colli Trevigiani)

description: Made from organically grown grapes, this Prosecco sticks out in a crowd. There are aromas here of apple skin, yellow candy and slightly awkward tones of piquant white pepper. It doesn't taste like textbook Prosecco, but cut it some slack because it is one of a handful or organic Prosecco sparklers in existence.
title: Mionetto NV Certified Organic Extra Dry Prosecco (Veneto)

description: An attractive, simple wine, with the freshest of citrus and melon flavors, pushed through by crisp acidity and a final hint of almonds. Screwcap.
title: Monte Largo 2008 White (Estremadura)

description: There's good, mouthwatering acidity in this Viognier, but it's not enough to balance out the sweet directness of the fruit. Tastes like apricot, peach and pineapple jam, almost a dessert wine.
title: Rivka Simone 2007 Viognier (Russian River Valley)

description: Fruity, oaky and simple, with tangerine, vanilla, buttered popcorn and smoky flavors. Drink now.
title: Saddleback 2008 Oakville Estate Pinot Blanc (Napa Valley)

description: Very soft and simple, with candied flavors of blackberries, cocoa, spices and oak. Perfectly fine for drinking now.
title: San Simeon 2006 Syrah (Monterey)

description: Fresh green plum, apricot and pears freshen this light, soft wine, clean, crisp and finishing with lime juice.
title: Companhia das Quintas 2008 Forgotten Field White (Estremadura)

description: Shows jammy flavors of blackberries and cherries, lightly touched with sweet, smoky oak. It's a bit rough in tannins, with some green notes, but at this price, a pretty good value.
title: Coyote Creek 2008 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)

description: Elegant and crisp, with a cherry-berry nose that gives way to strawberry and lingonberry in the mouth. The medium finish shows nice earth and cherry flavors set in a bed of fine tannins. Drink 1 to 2 years.
title: Damiani 2007 Pinot Noir (Finger Lakes)

description: Leathery and rubbery at first, with aromatic accents of celery seed, barnyard and melted tar. The palate is lighter than the nose, with herbal plum flavors and a lean, strained body. Thin and fresh, but nothing special.
title: De Lozar 2007  Ribera del Duero

description: Friendly, appealing flavors fo pear, lychee, apple and spice give this Riesling a fun character. Fresh with a touch of sweetness, the wine is balanced by its acid and offers a pretty, lingering finish.
title: Debonné 2008 Reserve Riesling (Grand River Valley)

description: Super-fruity, with jammy flavors of pineapples, green apples, peaches and spicy golden mango. A bit sugary sweet, too.
title: Gundlach Bundschu 2007 Estate Vineyard Chardonnay (Sonoma Valley)

description: On the lean side, with green, herbal notes that impart a tough edge to the cherry flavors.
title: Maison Bouachon 2005 Pierrelongue Red (Vacqueyras)

description: Already showing some signs of age in its slightly browning rim, this Cab boasts scents of eucalyptus, vanilla, cinnamon and red cherries, but it's all overly delicate-almost lacy. There's just not enough there to score higher despite its charms.
title: Palmer 1998 Cabernet Sauvignon (North Fork of Long Island)

description: Just swamped by oak, the slight fruit here is a platform for the wood, yielding heavy cedar and prune flavors. It looks a bit old—odd at this age—and although even on the palate, it doesn't offer much in the way of mouthfeel or finish. Perhaps in the barrel too long, this wine is gone before its time.
title: Campomaggio 1998  Chianti Classico

description: Apple-cider and earth aromas open to a simple apple-toast palate. The mouthfeel is even, the finish dry and rather woody. Then again, there are few drinkable California Chardonnays of this age.
title: Gan Eden 1994 Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

description: Aromas of vanilla and stewed berries lead into a palate that features more of the same: sweet wood and overripe raspberries. Syrupy and simple.
title: Laurel Lake 1998 Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (North Fork of Long Island)

description: Herb and mineral aromas and flavors prevail in this dry, light-to-medium-weight sparkler. It has decent texture, but the flavors bear a medicinal quality ending with a slight bitterness.
title: Royale NV Brut NV Blanc de Blancs  (Alsace)

description: Starts off strong, with pleasant tangelo aromas and flavors.  But somwehere along the line the flavors turn varnishy, finishing with a strong note of lacquer.
title: Castello di Borghese 1999 Hargrave Vineyard Pinot Blanc (North Fork of Long Island)

description: Shows lean red berry and herb aromas. Mild tea and currant flavors play on the tongue, but the desired weight and texture of Shiraz aren't there. Finishes short, with a tea note.
title: Carmel 1998 Vineyards Selected Shiraz (Shomron)

description: This wine shows some of the less appealing aspects of American oak: overt spice and vanilla flavors and a slick, oily mouthfeel.
title: Hargrave 1998 Chardonnay (North Fork of Long Island)

description: Strong mint and menthol aromatics give way to intense fresh-cut cedar flavors. There's just too much wood for this woodchuck to chuck.
title: Hargrave 1998 Merlot (North Fork of Long Island)

description: The juice here seems good, with dark cherry, licorice and chocolate elements, decent structure, and fine tannins. However, you need to get past a strong sulfur component on the nose that just doesn't yield.
title: Pruneto 1996 Riserva  (Chianti Classico)

description: Strong mint and menthol aromatics give way to intense fresh-cut cedar flavors.  There's just too much wood for this woodchuck to chuck.
title: Castello di Borghese 1998 Hargrave Vineyard Merlot (North Fork of Long Island)

description: Though young in age, this has a light brown tinge and an orange-peel edge to its berry and herb aromas and flavors. There's a touch of soy and leather for complexity, and an even finish, but not the life or verve that makes us enthusiastic.
title: Piccini 1999  Chianti

description: This wine shows some of the less appealing aspects of American oak: overt spice and vanilla flavors and a slick, oily mouthfeel.
title: Castello di Borghese 1998 Hargrave  Vineyard Chardonnay (North Fork of Long Island)

description: Bright berry and red-currant aromas. Lighter in style than Cabs being produced by other LI wineries. The finish turns tough and leathery, not a good match for the delicate fruit.
title: Channing Perrine 1998 Mudd Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Long Island)

description: This is a big burly wine that just has too many off aromas. Heavy barnyard scents mix with tart berry and espresso elements, and although there's body here, and what seem to be basically good elements, the stable-like odors stop the show.
title: Colognole 1997 Chianti Rufina  (Chianti Rufina)

description: This is very light, in both flavor and body. The aromas are earthy, with a faint suggestion of blackberries, and the mouthfeel is thin. These aren't terrible flaws, but the wine just lacks substance.
title: Château Maine-Gazin 1997  Bordeaux

description: The modest cherry, dark berry and black tea notes of this light wine show tell-tale orange-peel notes of decline. This feels just too thin and tired at an early age.
title: Valiano 1997  Chianti Classico

description: An absense of the variety's trademark floral and peach aromatics presages the lack of ripeness found on the palate.  An angular peppery streak of green fruit runs through the wine from start to finish, despite good palate presence.
title: Martha Clara 1999 Viognier (North Fork of Long Island)

description: This is very light, in both flavor and body. The aromas are earthy, with a faint suggestion of blackberries, and the mouthfeel is thin. These aren't terrible flaws, but the wine just lacks substance.
title: Château Maine-Gazin 1997  Bordeaux

description: The nose offers earthy, medicinal notes on the light black-cherry fruit. Thin on the palate, it has a cough syrup-like taste. The tannins are soft, the acids low. Finishes short.
title: Barkan 1996 Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Galil)

description: Rather dilute, it shows slight black-cherry and blackberry aromas and flavors. The overall impression is really little more than alcohol and faint body. Finishes very dry, with innocuous tannins.
title: Alfasi 1998 Reserve Merlot (Maule Valley)

description: Sometimes Franc can have a lovely, alluringly floral bouquet; other times it can be downright vegetal and display green-bean characteristics. Unfortunately, this is an example of the latter. The wine has nice weight and texture, so if you don't mind your veggies in liquid form this might be more to your liking.
title: Macari 1997 Estate Bottled Cabernet Franc (North Fork of Long Island)

description: Vanilla, butterscotch and some harsher oak-derived compounds dominate the modest citrus fruit that might have been wine before it was turned into oak juice. For wood lovers only.
title: Laurel Lake 1998 Reserve Chardonnay (North Fork of Long Island)

description: As unevolved as they are, the dense and multilayered aromas and flavors are truly impressive here. Black currant, herb, tea, oak, vanilla, maple, anise, blueberries and more--it could be an excercise in overkill, if all the parts weren't in such fine harmony. Really big, but with excellent balance, this reveals much less now than the RWT. It is everything a flagship wine in its infancy should be--immaculate component parts, superbly full on the palate, possessed of great length and incredible potential. An absolute keeper to visit in 7, 15 or 25 years. To be released 5/01.
title: Penfolds 1996 Grange Shiraz (South Australia)

description: Seamless luxury from stem to stern, this ‘baby Grange' is  impressive juice. Blackberry, menthol and smoke play unusually elegantly on the nose, the texture is velvet on the tongue with dark berry, coffee, licorice and muted black pepper flavors. The superb, very long finish combines all the elements with wonderful finesse and a rare grace. Not inexpensive, but fairly priced; you could pay twice as much for half the wine, almost any day in any fine wine store in the country. To be released 5/01.
title: Penfolds 1998 RWT Shiraz (Barossa Valley)

description: A juicy, jammy, alcoholic style, tannic and young. This is gutsy, high-toned wine, with fat, extracted fruit. Very dry tannins, good balance. This wine needs time; it's a very different style from the other Claudia Springs Zins. But it shows the same attention to detail, intense fruit, and stylish, sensitive winemaking.
title: Claudia Springs 1998 Rhodes Vineyard Zinfandel (Redwood Valley)

description: There's a lovely sweetness to the fruit, which tastes like ripe, just-picked blackberries. Old vines, 100+ years, deliver sweet, supple, sexy fruit. The wine has very dry tannins, and it might profit from some blending, but with a vineyard this special you have to admire the single-vineyard approach.
title: Cline 1998 Live Oak Vineyard Zinfandel (Contra Costa County)

description: A voluptuous blockbuster in the style we are becoming accustomed to from über-consultant Michel Rolland: big, deeply fruited (black cherries) and plush, with elegantly etched spice shadings from new oak. The tannins are supple but substantial; it should age for a long time. Made entirely from old-vine Malbec and named after the pigeon coop in the Château's courtyard.
title: Château Lagrézette 1997 Le Pigeonnier Malbec (Cahors)

description: Zin with a Pinot sensibility; it's bright, spicy and forward. Sweet, delicious fruit, with accents of cinnamon, cardamom and anise. This is an elegant and subtle wine, but unusually long and complex, with wonderful structure. Enticing, enchanting wine.
title: Claudia Springs 1998 Eagle Point Ranch Zinfandel (Mendocino)

description: A blast of spice, mint, bramble and pepper explodes from the glass. The wine is dense, dark, deep and mysterious; the flavors pungent, penetrating and persistent. Tannic, layered with herbs and spices, powered with big, punchy fruit. This is classic Cline.
title: Cline 1998 Big Break Vineyard Zinfandel (Contra Costa County)

description: Tastes like a dessert pastry, with baked cherry, cassis, peppermint, milk chocolate and anise flavors that are a little sweet and honeyed. Pleasant, but not impactful. Drink now.
title: Sunstone 2005 Estate Merlot (Santa Ynez Valley)

description: This Aglianico from Irpinia is thin in appearance and offers awkward notes of apple cider, black mineral, cherry, blueberry and spice. The nose is a bit muddled but the wine drinks well thanks to its solid structure and polished tannins.
title: Tenuta Ponte 2005 Aglianico (Irpinia)

description: Floral, spicy and sweet on the nose, and with a straightforward, refreshing blend of typical Riesling flavors, this wine is dependable and pretty, and will pair well with spicy Asian and Indian cuisine. A touch sweet but clean.
title: Jana 2007 Riesling (Leelanau Peninsula)

description: Modest cherry and strawberry notes appear on the nose and the palate, with some slightly herbal flavors as well. It's light in body, with soft acids and a relatively quick finish.
title: Jindalee 2007 Circle Collection Rosé (South Eastern Australia)

description: An elegant nose of deep spice and fruit leads on this Meritage from the Snake River Valley of Idaho—an emerging region to watch for interesting reds. The wine offers sturdy red fruit, spice and structure, and seems made for hearty fare like grilled steaks or, if you feel like splurging, a kobe burger.
title: Koenig Vineyards 2004 Cuvée Alden Private Reserve Red Meritage

description: A bit funky and gassy on the nose, and while the wine offers ripeness and sweetness on the palate, there's always a little something strange and sulfuric lingering. It has its plum and acidity, but the tannins and overall mouthfeel are grabby.
title: Martín Berdugo 2006 Joven  (Ribera del Duero)

description: With just a touch of oak, this is a pretty good Sauvignon Blanc. It's a little sweet in fig, citrus, passionfruit and melon flavors, but those Monterey acids are brisk and provide a clean balance.
title: Morgan 2007 Sauvignon Blanc (Monterey)

description: De Bortoli's unique approach to harvest timing and extensive use of new oak leaves this wine seeming rather disjointed: coffee and cola notes dominate the tart, cranberryish fruit flavors. I suspect it will show better with a few years' of cellaring, but until then, I remain unconvinced.
title: De Bortoli 2006 Reserve Release Pinot Noir (Yarra Valley)

description: This wine is a solid, stylish Meritage with assertive red fruit, a black pepper backbone and plenty of structure for aging. A touch of oaked spice adds dimension. A good overall red to pair with hearty winter fare.
title: Atwater 2005 Red Table Wine Meritage (Finger Lakes)

description: There's a disagreeable sharpness and harshness to this Merlot. Despite some pleasant cherry, berry and oak flavors and a lush texture, that rough tartness persists through the finish.
title: Bell 2004 Merlot (Napa Valley)

description: Smoky, elegant and soft aromas of leather, pepper and berry lead into flavors of cherry and cigarbox spice on the palate of this approachable Cabernet. The wine is not terribly complex, but good structure and acidity give it cellaring potential, and paired with duck, lamb or beef dishes, it will make a very nice addition to the table.
title: Bellangelo 2005 Cabernet Sauvignon (Finger Lakes)

description: Warm and earthy at first, but more soupy as it opens. Crisp, snappy red-fruit flavors are also on the herbal side. Nervy yet it does show a reasonable amount of honest Rioja quality. Still, for a 2001 reserva it doesn't amount to much.
title: Castillo Clavijo 2001 Reserva  (Rioja)

description: Awkward notes at the beginning blow off quickly to reveal mature notes of plum, raisin and blackberry jam. The wine tastes thick and slightly sweet and has a chewy, dense mouthfeel.
title: Vigne & Vini 2004 Moi  (Primitivo di Manduria)

description: This lush white starts with a nose of apricot and honey and leads into tropical fruit flavors balanced by a good acidity. Indulgent but fresh, it's a fun wine that will pair well with spicy Thai or Indian cuisine.
title: Bully Hill NV Ravat 51 White (New York)

description: Burnt oak, tire rubber and bramble vie with blackberry and vanilla aromas. The palate is brambly and a little lean, with strawberry and raspberry flavors taking on some grassy wildness. Simply stated, the fruit flavors just aren't of the highest order. Otherwise, it's good enough.
title: Anta 2004 A10 Nuestra Perfección  (Ribera del Duero)

description: Big spice and blackberry/cherry aromas start this wine out right, and on the palate, a rustic underlay of tobacco and pepper adds character. Good structure and acidity add a food-friendly edge. A wine that is easy to drink and well made.
title: Billsboro 2006 Cabernet Sauvignon (Finger Lakes)

description: This wine has an elegant edge, with its hints of tea, spice and mint on the nose and its pleasant, harmonious plum and red berry flavors on the palate. Easy to drink and food-pairing friendly.
title: Casa Rondeña Winery 2005 Meritage (New Mexico)

description: Lemon citrus, toast, white flowers—the lead on this wine is feminine and light and, as the name suggests, feels like a warm weather match. Flavors of like style are sweet and simple but balanced by some crispness and finesse. It's a pretty wine that offers simple, easy drinking enjoyment.
title: Chaddsford 2007 Spring Wine White (Pennsylvania)

description: Slightly prickly and peppery on the nose, but there's enough clean red-fruit aromas and dustiness to bring it along. The palate is simple and nice enough, with tight acidity, stanching dryness and zest. A good but limited wine that delivers what it should but nothing beyond that.
title: Darien 2006  Rioja

description: Quite tannic and biting, but beyond those mouthfeel issues this affordable RDD has its positives. The bouquet of toast, mocha and coconut is alluring, and then the palate of dark-fruit flavors, while rock-hard, is masculine. But never does one escape the feel and balance shortcomings. It's a like a ride down a pocked and bumpy gravel road.
title: Finca Torremilanos 2006 Monte Castrillo  (Ribera del Duero)

description: Cherry and mocha on the nose start this wine nicely, and the flavors to follow—cherry, pepper, spice—are balanced and elegant. The tannins are somewhat aggressive and need time to soften. Give the wine 2–5 years and watch it unfold.
designation: Keuka Hill Reserve Red Table Wine
title: Shaw NV Keuka Hill Reserve Red Table Wine Red (Finger Lakes)

description: Simple and a little sweet, this Cab shows very ripe, jammy flavors of blackberries, cassis and cola. It's an easy sipper, with a pleasant scour of tannins.
title: Sonoma Creek 2006 Cabernet Sauvignon (Dry Creek Valley)

description: A soft, dry and easy wine to like, this Merlot has flavors of cherries, blackberries, Asian spices and cola, with smoky overtones of oak. Drink now.
title: Sunstone 2005 Merlot (Santa Barbara County)

description: Here's a ripe, slightly cooked Sangiovese from Puglia with a brownish color and full aromas of ripe raspberry and strawberry jam. It's chewy and slightly sour in the mouth with polished tannins. Drink now.
title: Tiamo 2005 Sangiovese (Puglia)

description: How's this for exotic: this red blend is made from the vinifera grapes Saperavi (from the former Soviet Georgia) and Sereksiya Charni (generally from Moldova). On the nose, the wine displays clove, tart berry, raspberry and black pepper, and on the palate, like flavors and solid tannins. There's a touch of dried tea to the blend and a decent finish, but the wine needs time to age--consider holding it for 5-10 years for the complexity to unfold. Overall, an appealing and interesting choice.
title: McGregor 2005 Black Russian Red Red (Finger Lakes)

description: This unoaked Sauvignon Blanc is crisply acidic, with honey-infused lemon, lime and pink grapefruit flavors. It has an edge of acrid gooseberries that some people will find troublesome, while others will compare it favorably to New Zealand wines.
title: Frog's Leap 2007 Sauvignon Blanc (Rutherford)

description: A blend of Tintore and Per'e Palummo (a grape native to the Island of Ischia), there is a thorny, raw quality to this wine that is backed by Asian spice, incense, spice, tobacco and mature black fruit. The wine has a thin, almost metallic taste, with spicy fruit tones on the close.
title: Giuseppe Apicella 2006 Costa d'Amalfi Tramonti Red (Campania)

description: Red in color and pretty clean on the nose, where raspberry and rose petal essence come together. The palate is acidic and tight, with tangy watermelon and peach flavors carrying the cleansing finish. Juicy to the extreme, but a good partner for food.
title: Coto de Hayas 2007 Rosado Rosé (Campo de Borja)

description: The nose here is very sweet and ripe and recalls mature pear, cantaloupe and grapefruit. A blend of Coda di Volpe and 20% Falanghina harvested from the slopes of Mount Vesuvius, the wine offers a smooth but lean consistency and power in the mouth with long-lasting freshness on the close.
title: Digi Or NV Coda di Volpe (Lacryma Christi del Vesuvio)

description: Honey and toasted spice aromas are followed by an elegant balance of curvy fruit and acid in this stylish Viognier from Arizona. The viscous mouthfeel and honeyed finish add to the package. Pair this with a good curry or spicy Chinese dish for an interesting balance.
title: Dos Cabezas 2006 Viognier (Cochise County)

description: The winery is in eastern Oregon, near the Idaho border, but the grapes were sourced from an unnamed Willamette Valley vineyard. A bit high-toned, with sharply defined strawberry and cherry fruit, this finishes with a burst of caramel and mocha.
title: Copper Belt 2013 Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: Earthy, mature, beefy flavors lend an unorthodox but tasty personality, while medium body and light tannins form an appetizing mouthfeel. This variety is known for its earthy, wild character, so enjoy it!
title: Dante Robere 2013 Love Ranch Vineyard Mourvèdre (Madera)
